subject: Re: [junit] XMLUnit and halting
msgSnippet: ... If that proves to difficult, the stop-gap measure would be to catch the AssertionFailedError and continue processing.  However, splitting up the test is
messageBody:
On Monday 22 November 2004 03:53, Chris Dollin wrote:
> On Saturday 20 November 2004 01:21, Meka, Indira, IG wrote:
> > How do I make the tests not halt when there is an exception in the one
> > of the asserts calls ( assertxpathexists) , but continue checking other
> > paths?
>
> By rewriting your tests so that you don't want to continue. You've
> written multiple tests and stuffed them into a single method;
> separate them out so that tests with "independant" failures are in
> separate test methods.

If that proves to difficult, the stop-gap measure would be to catch the
AssertionFailedError and continue processing. However, splitting up the test
is certainly more preferred when possible.

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
